intro: Sorbus aria f. lutescens, commonly known as the golden-hairy whitebeam, is a cultivated form of the whitebeam tree. It is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow foliage, which stands out against its grey-green leaves. The plant produces small, white berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for ornamental gardens. This variety is valued for its unique coloration and hardy nature, adding visual interest to landscapes.
